documents.title: six parties interested in buying bradford bulls
text: six different parties have expressed `` serious interest '' in buying the bradford bulls , according to the championship club 's administrators .
the four-time super league champions were placed in administration for the third time on monday .
the club 's membership of the rugby football league has also been terminated and the club could face a points deduction or relegation .
joint administrator gary pettit said : `` we are excited by the interest shown
`` we consider that several of the parties appear to have sufficient resources and experience to take bradford bulls forward . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: sharon beshenivsky murder : investigation remains ongoing
text: police investigating the murder of pc sharon beshenivsky have renewed their appeal for information on the eleventh anniversary of her death .
det supt simon atkinson , of the homicide and major enquiry team wants information about piran dhitta khan , who officers want to trace in connection with the inquiry .
pc beshenivsky was fatally shot while attending a report of an armed robbery in morley street today in bradford in 2005. undefined
members of west yorkshire police will be attending her annual memorial service in bradford city centre later today .
det supt atkinson , said : `` this investigation remains ongoing and will continue until everyone involved in pc beshenivsky 's murder has been brought to justice .
`` our efforts are continuing to trace piran dhitta khan , who will now be 68 .

`` he is thought to be living in pakistan and we are again appealing directly to the people of pakistan , as well as those in west yorkshire and across the country to come forward and provide information on his whereabouts . ''
a £ 20,000 reward is on offer for information leading to his capture and anyone who can assist the inquiry can contact the independent charity crimestoppers on 0800 555111 .

documents.title: burglars who targeted new builds jailed
text: a pair of burglars who targeted new homes across west yorkshire have been jailed .
thomas quinn , 37 , and gordon hopkins , 39 , broke into the homes in wakefield , castleford , dewsbury , huddersfield , batley , cleckheaton and leeds between october 2015 and april 2016 .
they stole the car keys they found inside and then made off with the vehicles .
in their seven-month spree they stole cars worth £ 238,000 in 13 burglaries .
quinn ( top ) and hopkins ( above ) who are both from leeds were sentenced to five years and six years respectively at leeds crown court .
they are calculating experienced criminals who preyed on their vitcims to the fullest extent . ''

documents.title: david hockney : painting breaks record
text: a new auction record was set for a painting by bradford-born artist david hockney in new york last night .
the 79-year-old 's woldgate woods , 24 , 25 and 26 october , 2006 went for $ 11.7m ( £ 9.4m ) .
the 10ft painting , made up of six individual pieces highlighting the landscape of east yorkshire , had a guide price of between $ 9m and $ 12m .
the previous hockney auction record was $ 7.9m ( £ 6.3 million ) , set in 2009 .

documents.title: sharon beshenivsky : 11th anniversary of her murder
text: today marks the 11th anniversary of the murder of pc sharon beshenivsky in bradford .
mrs beshenivsky was killed outside a travel agency in morley street on 18 november 2005 while responding to an armed robbery call .
the mother of three and stepmother of two died after she was shot in the chest on what was her youngest daughter lydia 's fourth birthday .
two men were jailed for life for her murder .
her shift partner , pc teresa milburn , was also shot and injured during the incident .

documents.title: newsome mill fire is the latest in a spate of arson attacks
text: a mill fire in huddersfield is the latest in a number of arson attacks but the fire service say they have n't yet found a link .
fire crews were called to newsome mill on ruth street at about 04:50 this morning .
at its height about 100 firefighters tackled the blaze and nearby homes were evacuated .
there 's been a number of similar blazes in unoccupied or derelict buildings , including a substantial number of fires at the old kirklees college building in new north road .
we are working with our police colleagues but at the moment we can not identify a link between these fires .

we would like the owners of these types of unoccupied buildings to take every precaution to prevent a fire in their property , specifically making the building as secure as possible and keeping a regular eye on it .
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: overcrowded rail services to improve in parts of west yorkshire
text: the government is promising that rail services in parts of west yorkshire will improve after complaints of overcrowding .
the labour mp for halifax , holly lynch , told the commons that passengers were being crushed because of a reduction in the number of carriages .
two morning trains from halifax to leeds have been cut from four carriages to two leading to quite serious overcrowding .
these services connecting our major northern towns and cities are essential to delivering the northern powerhouse .
so can the minister tell us what he is doing to avoid the crush we are seeing on these commuter services .
the rail minister paul maynard said changes were being introduced to increase the number of seats on board .

i 'm very aware this a busy line and its why we are seeking for the new northern franchise to tackle overcrowding with investment in new rolling stock to increase capacity by 37 % on peak services into our northern cities at peak hours .
there will be improvement on the line .

documents.title: leeds will light up red for world aids day
text: sexual health experts will be encouraging people to get tested for national hiv testing week which starts on friday .
there 'll be extra hiv testing sessions and its an opportunity for people in leeds to learn more about the condition .
it 's followed by world aids day on 1 december .
national hiv testing week is a great chance for more people to increase their knowledge of hiv and if appropriate have a simple , fast hiv test .
being aware of your hiv status is really important and an earlier diagnosis can mean a healthier and longer life .
i am delighted so many key buildings are being lit red to highlight our support as a city for world aids day 2016 .

documents.title: supermarket asda see a drop in sales
text: west yorkshire-based asda has reported another big slide in sales .
the supermarket , which has its headquarters in leeds , was down nearly 6 % in the three months to september .
however , the rate of decline has slowed .
in the previous quarter , sales fell by over 7 % .
the results are the first under new chief executive sean clarke , who took over in july .

documents.title: comic artist wanted for wakefield museums job
text: did you know wakefield museums have ballot boxes which were used in the first secret parliamentary elections ?
putting a cross on a ballot paper is taken for granted these days , but it was the pontefract by-election in 1872 that changed the democratic process and made elections safer and fairer .
wakefield museums are looking for a comic artist to bring the story of pontefract 's secret ballot to life and create a humorous interpretation of the story .

documents.title: eat from the bishop 's table in leeds
text: a cooking bishop is offering his services to a pay-as-you-feel event in leeds .
bishop paul slater , a suffragan bishop in the anglican diocese of leeds , will .
create a real junk food menu .

the real junk food cafe at all hallows church , hyde park is part of the real junkfood project network of cafes which prepare meals from donated supermarket and restaurant food that would otherwise go to landfill.. customers pay what they feel able to , either with money or volunteering time .
it 's been calculated that every £ 1 invested in the cafe has generated fifteen pounds in social return .
the bishop 's bistro takes place on tuesday , november 22 at all hallows church in leeds .

documents.title: police race teenagers in pontefract in go-karts !
text: west yorkshire police have gone head to head with teenagers in pontefract in a go karting skills project .
the 'top cops ' took on teenagers in the club set up to teach young people basic mechanics and teamwork to help reduce anti-social behaviour .
this year , out of 505 teams in the british schools karting championships they finished 15th which shows just how hard they 've worked .

documents.title: efit appeal over sex assault in 2013
text: do you recognise this man ?
west yorkshire police want to speak to him in connection with a sexual assault in 2013 .
the assault happened outside big fella 's nightclub on beastfair in the town between 4 and 5 december , 2013 .
the victim - a woman in her 30s - was attacked in an alleyway after speaking to the suspect in the club .
he was wearing a brown leather bomber style jacket and pointy loafer style shoes .
anyone with information is asked to contact police .

documents.title: breakingnewsome mill fire was 'suspected arson '
text: the cause of a major fire at a former woollen mill in huddersfield earlier is being treated as suspected arson .
fire crews were called to newsome mill on ruth street at about 04:50 this morning .
at its height about 100 firefighters tackled the blaze and nearby homes were evacuated .
police are now appealing for anyone who saw any sus activity in the area to get in touch as soon as possible .

documents.title: obesity in bradford is a crisis of 'epic proportions ' - report
text: bradford 's obesity problems have reached crisis levels , according to an official report .
councillors are due to consider the report later which claims more than two thirds of the city 's adult population are overweight .
some of the health problems being faced by local residents in bradford are being blamed on the number of takeaways in the city .

documents.title: taxi driver 'saw stabbing ' of jo cox
text: a taxi driver saw a man stab mp jo cox `` about five times '' , a jury at the old bailey has heard .
taxi driver rashid hussain said he confronted the man near birstall library after he heard screaming and shouting , saw him shoot at mrs cox and heard him shout `` britain first '' .
mrs cox , 41 , was shot and stabbed in birstall , west yorkshire , on 16 june , a week before the eu referendum vote .
thomas mair ( 53 , from birstall , denies murder .
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: newsome mill fire : latest update
text: it could be `` some time '' before people evacuated due to a major blaze at newsome mill in huddersfield can return to their homes , according to west yorkshire fire service
the fire started at about 04:50 this morning and at its height about 100 firefighters were tackling the blaze .
ian bitcon , from the fire service , says : `` quite a lot of people have been evacuated from the surrounding area .
the ones who are a little more distant are moving back in , but for the ones closer to the building it could be some time . ''
about 10 fire crews - 50 firefighters - remain at the scene now and mr bitcon says he expects they 'll be at the scene for the rest of the day .

documents.title: at the scene : newsome mill fire in huddersfield
text: i 'm at the scene of the major fire at newsome mill in huddersfield which started in the early hours of this morning and has been tackled by about 100 firefighters .
i 'm currently looking at a shell of a building - there 's no roof , the windows are out and all the floors have dropped down .
there 's still a large presence of fire crews at both sides of the building and water is still being streamed in to try and cool things down and smoke is billowing out .
however , newsome road has now been reopened and traffic is starting to make its way down there so hopefully the commute should be a little easier now .
author: Charles Engwell
Reporter, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: school closed due to newsome mill fire
text: as a result of the fire at newsome mill in huddersfield , nearby hillside primary school will be closed for the day , the school has said .

the fire service seem `` to have got it under control '' , according to mr holmes .

documents.title: jo cox case : latest from the old bailey
text: today the old bailey has been hearing evidence in the trial of the man accused of murdering mp jo cox .
thomas mair , 53 , of birstall , denies murdering the labour mp .
the court heard from fazila aswat , mrs cox 's manager , who was with her when the attack took place .
she said she , mrs cox and senior caseworker sandra major had parked their car and were about to go to the library for a constituency surgery when it happened .
ms aswat told the court how she screamed for help as a man with a knife stood over the mp , who was on the ground , and pleaded for her to run .
the man retreated but returned to continue the attack , as more people gathered round .
she tried to hit him with her handbag , but missed , the court heard .
ms aswat said she told mrs cox to think of her children , before going behind a car , from where she heard gunshots .
she said she thought mrs cox had been stabbed first and then shot at close range .
at the end of the attack , the knifeman stood up and said `` britain first , this is for britain .
britain will always come first , '' before walking off , jurors were told .

documents.title: jo cox murder trial latest
text: more details have been emerging in the trial of thomas mair , who is accused of murdering west yorkshire mp jo cox on 16 june .
he denies the murder .

pc nicholls ( left ) told the court he was on unarmed patrol in a marked police car in birstall with colleague pc jonathan wright when they were told to search for a man thought to be involved in a shooting .
just after 13:30 they spotted a man on leeds road , wearing a black baseball cap and carrying a black holdall in his hand and followed him to risedale avenue , a cul-de-sac residential street .
the officers asked him to show his hands and he dropped the bag .
he turned around to police , put his hands in his pockets and change fell out .
he put his arms up and said `` it 's me '' , pc nicholls told the court .
the officers got out of the patrol car , ran towards him and rugby tackled him to the ground with a `` heavy impact '' , the arresting officer said .
an ambulance took him to leeds general infirmary for treatment before he was later taken to a police station .
the trial continues .

documents.title: jo cox accused 'had bag of bullets '
text: more from the trial of thomas mair , the man accused of murdering batley mp jo cox .
pc craig nicholls said he saw what looked like a pistol in a black holdall when he and pc jonathan wright detained the man in birstall , west yorkshire .
pc nicholls said the man put his arms up and said `` it 's me '' when the officers arrested him on 16 june .
thomas mair , 53 , from birstall , denies murder .
he is accused of shooting and stabbing the mp .
the trial continues .

documents.title: police 'rugby tackled ' jo cox accused

pc nicholls said the man put his arms up and said `` it 's me '' when the officers arrested him on 16 june .
thomas mair , 53 , from birstall , denies murder .

documents.title: fall in unemployment in yorkshire
text: the latest unemployment figures show a drop in the number of people out of work in our region .
the number of people without a job in yorkshire and the humber between july and september stood at 151,000 - that 's down by 7,000 on the previous quarter , a fall of 5.6 % .
the national figure 's also fallen - by 37,000 to 1.6 million .
that 's the lowest level for 11 years .

documents.title: childhood coughs could help treatment for lung cancer
text: a virus that causes childhood coughs could help in the fight against liver cancer according to scientists in leeds .
they 've discovered that an illness called reovirus could be used to stimulate our immune system and kill off cancer cells - along with the underlying causes .
the point of us having it when we 're children is that when we 're adults we tend to be immune to that virus .
however , if we administer it therapeutically it still has an effect on our immune system and we can harness that to treat the cancers . ''

documents.title: soldiers to be given training to deal with flooding
text: yorkshire soldiers are due to be given training later in how to set up temporary flood defences , almost a year after the devastating boxing day floods .

the 2nd battalion yorkshire regiment will be given the training by the environment agency - which has prepared for winter by having in place around 24 miles of temporary barrier - that 's five times as many as last year - as well as 250 high volume pumps .
key equipment for dealing with floods is also to be stored at seven strategic locations across the country , including at riccall in north yorkshire .

documents.title: kirkstall road crash : tributes to cyclist
text: tributes have been paid to a 33-year-old cyclist who died after a crash on kirkstall road in leeds yesterday .
a white bike has appeared near the scene of the crash and people have been leaving flowers .
the driver of a car which crashed into two shops remains in intensive care .
the accident closed kirkstall road for several hours causing massive delays to commuters .
two men have been arrested and bailed over the incident .

documents.title: jo cox trial due to resume today after delay
text: the trial of the man accused of murdering west yorkshire mp jo cox is expected to resume this morning .
mrs cox was stabbed 15 times and shot three times outside her constituency surgery in birstall , near leeds , on 16 june .
the trial had to be delayed yesterday because of a stoppage by prison officers which meant thomas mair could n't be taken to the old bailey .
mr mair , 53 , from birstall , denies murder .

documents.title: halifax piece hall restoration completion delayed until next year
text: a £ 19m restoration of halifax 's piece hall is now running at least a year behind schedule , the bbc has learned .
the project involves repairing the grade i listed building as well as creating cafes , shops , a restaurant and a heritage centre .
it was due to open earlier this year , but calderdale council leader tim swift says problems - including the discovery of an ancient graveyard - have delayed it until mid-2017 .

documents.title: hs2 : west yorkshire routes confirmed
text: the government has announced the route for the second phase of the high-speed rail line hs2 , from crewe to manchester and the west midlands to leeds :
critics of the £ 56bn project say it is a white elephant that will spoil some of britain 's most beautiful countryside .
but the government says the new rail infrastructure will boost the economy by billions of pounds .
the first phase of the £ 56bn railway is due to open in december 2026 and will see trains travel at high speed between london and birmingham before continuing on the existing west coast main line .
the second y-shaped phase , taking the high-speed line to yorkshire , north-west england , and beyond , is due to be completed by about 2032-33 .

documents.title: councillors vote against pay rise
text: believe it or not , it looks like councillors in bradford look set to reject a pay rise .
bradford council leader susan hinchcliffe said the ruling labour group should reject a proposed one percent increase in allowances for councillors .
an independent panel had recommended that they should be increased for this year and next .
councillors will make a decision in december 's full council meeting .
it was unanimous amongst labour councillors .
we have all seen in great detail how the government cuts are going to slash the services of bradford people over the next four years .
in good faith we can not therefore vote for an increase in our allowances .
there was no hesitation in reaching this decision . ''

documents.title: new incinerator opens in leeds
text: a multi-million pound waste incinerator on the outskirts of leeds has officially opened .
the site , next to the a63 , processes waste from homes across the city and turns what 's left into green energy .
the company which runs it , veolia , says it will generate enough electricity to power 22,000 houses .

lucinda yeadon , leeds city council 's executive member for environment and sustainability , says : `` this facility allows us to divert black bin waste away from landfill and into environmentally-friendly recycling or energy creation . ''

documents.title: prison officers ' walkout delays jo cox murder trial
text: the trial of thomas mair , who 's accused of murdering west yorkshire mp jo cox , will not go ahead today because of action by prison workers .
thousands of prison officers in england have stopped work amid health and safety concerns , their union has said .
the prison officers association said up to 10,000 members would take part in the day of protest , which would be `` interpreted as a strike '' , after talks with the government broke down .
thomas mair , 53 , allegedly repeatedly shot and stabbed the 41-year-old batley and spen mp outside her constituency surgery in birstall on 16 june .
the old bailey trial was due to hear the first witnesses in the case , but trial judge mr justice wilkie adjourned the case until 10:30 on wednesday because mr mair was not in the dock .

documents.title: hs2 : tunnel planned under woodlesford
text: away from the traffic problems in leeds , and to transport of a different kind :
the planned new route for hs2 will mean a tunnel almost half a mile long being built on the approach to leeds , an mp has said .
andrew jones , minister for hs2 and conservative mp for harrogate and knaresborough , says it would be a `` big change '' to the way the rail line comes into leeds .
the tunnel would run beneath woodlesford in west yorkshire .
the route through sheffield is still being considered , but one option includes cutting through a housing estate still being built .
a tunnel sounds better than a massive viaduct , although we have n't seen the actual plans .
there 's still more uncertainty but that 's the nature of the beast with hs2 . ''

documents.title: kirkstall road crash : two arrested after cyclist 's death
text: more details are emerging about the crash on kirkstall road which has left one man dead and another in a serious condition in hospital .
a silver volkswagen golf , which was travelling towards the city centre , collided with a 33-year-old male cyclist who was pronounced dead at the scene .
the golf overturned and crashed into in a parade of shops near the cardigan fields retail park .
two shops have suffered `` significant damage '' , say police .
the driver of the golf , a 22-year-old man , was seriously injured and was taken to leeds general infirmary where he 's currently in a stable condition in intensive care .

a volkswagen passat is also believed to have been involved in the incident and the occupants of that vehicle , two men aged 23 and 36 , from leeds , have been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving and are currently in custody .

documents.title: billy clarke 'on top of his form ' - mccall
text: bradford city manager stuart mccall says billy clarke deserves the plaudits following his 100th appearance for the club at the weekend .
the irishman scored the bantams ' first goal and set up the second in their 4-0 win against rochdale .
mccall says : `` he 's got a fantastic attitude to training .
he trains like he plays and leads by example .
he 's determined and , above all , he 's a good , good player and on top of his form .
`` i 'm delighted for him .
not only for the goal he got , but also the delivery .
i 'm very pleased . ''
author: Dave Fletcher

documents.title: knife point robbery at leeds shop
text: police are appealing for information following a knife point robbery at a leeds shop .

at about 14.40 on sunday 13 november a man entered sheikh 's store , in beeston road , and pushed the lone 28-year-old female member of staff to the floor , threatened her with a kitchen knife and demanded cash .
the man grabbed a quantity of cigarettes from the behind the counter and ran from store .
he was described as white , aged 28 to 35 , about 5ft 5ins tall , skinny , with short hair .
this was a frightening experience for the victim who bravely tried to defend herself against the suspect who was armed with a knife .
thankfully she was not injured . ''

documents.title: watch : 'supermoon ' viewers to get closest glimpse since 1948
text: skywatchers are preparing for the latest `` supermoon '' as earth 's satellite makes its closest approach since 1948 .
the uk 's best chance to see it will be on monday evening , with the moon set to rise at 16:43 gmt in edinburgh and at 16:44 in london .
to observers , it will appear about 7 % larger than normal and about 15 % brighter - although the human eye is barely able to discern that difference .

documents.title: man 'murdered mp jo cox in cowardly attack '
text: a man shouted `` britain first '' as he shot and stabbed labour mp jo cox to death in a `` cowardly attack '' , the old bailey has heard .
thomas mair , 53 , allegedly murdered mrs cox outside her constituency surgery in birstall , near leeds , on 16 june .
on the opening day of his trial , the prosecution told jurors the 41-year-old was `` brutally murdered in what was a planned and pre-meditated murder for a political and/or ideological cause '' .

documents.title: dementia now leading cause of death
text: dementia , including alzheimer 's disease , has overtaken heart disease as the leading cause of death in england and wales , latest figures reveal .
last year , more than 61,000 people died of dementia - 11.6 % of all recorded deaths .
the office for national statistics says the change is largely due to an ageing population .

documents.title: bradford bulls in administration : club 's future 'still strong ' - chairman
text: the future of bradford bulls is `` still strong '' , despite the club being placed into administration for the third time , the club 's chairman has said .

in a statement on the bulls ' website , marc green says he 's been talking to `` serious investors '' after the club faced a winding-up petition from her majesty 's revenue and customs ( hmrc ) , but pressure from hmrc has now forced the club into this position `` to save its future '' .
`` i will be working closely with the administrators over the coming weeks and it is my intention to regain this club from them within the shortest practicable time frame , '' mr green says .

`` regardless of whether i remain at the helm of this great club , i will ensure all memberships already purchased for next season will remain valid , as will the offer under which they were purchased .
`` i believe the future of bradford bulls is still strong , '' he concludes .

documents.title: arriva bus strikes : services affected
text: more now on the news that hundreds of arriva bus drivers are staging a 24-hour strike over pay and shifts .
the walkout started at 03:00 this morning and bus passengers are being urged to plan for a longer journey .
the main areas affected are cleckheaton , dewsbury and heckmondwike as well as some services to and from leeds .
arriva has posted a comprehensive list of services affected on their website - which you can find here .

documents.title: breakingbradford bulls : championship club placed in administration for third time
text: championship rugby league club bradford bulls have been placed in administration for the third time .
bradford , who entered administration in both 2012 and 2014 , faced a winding-up petition from hm revenue & customs in october .
bulls chairman marc green said : `` i have been talking to a number of serious investors and purely the pressure from hmrc has forced the club to be put into this position to save its future . ''
author: BBC West Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: listen : one third of people in yorkshire 'bullied at work '
text: nearly a third of people in yorkshire have been bullied in the workplace , it 's being claimed .
a new study 's been published to mark the start of anti-bullying week , highlighting that over 60 % of cases also go unreported .
employment lawyer victoria lewis told bbc radio leeds bullying can lead to depression , marriage breakdown and even suicidal thoughts .

documents.title: kirklees politicians face local residents at q & a event
text: a chance to grill kirklees politicians at a question time-style debate will be hosted in huddersfield , with the main topic being how the council manages its budget .
author: Huddersfield Examiner

documents.title: 'low carbon ' electricity in ascendant - drax
text: for the first time ever over half of britain 's electricity is `` low carbon '' , according to the owners of yorkshire 's drax power station near selby .
the firm has been looking at electricity production over the last quarter of this year and describes the news as `` dramatic '' and `` ground-breaking '' .
it says low carbon sources - nuclear , biomass , hydro , wind and solar - made up 50.2 % of our total .
that 's a big jump from six years ago , when these sources produced just 20 % , the firm says , with just 3 % of our electricity now coming from burning coal .
drax says that 's down to something called the carbon price floor - george osborne 's 2011 measure which financially penalises producers of greenhouse gases .

documents.title: giants sign gaskell from bradford
text: huddersfield giants have signed stand off lee gaskell on a four-year deal from bradford bulls .
the 26-year-old was the 2015 championship player of the year with the bulls , having previously played for st helens .
gaskell has told the giants website : `` to be back in super league is a great feeling and to be given this chance by the giants is pleasing and it 's something i 'm looking forward to .
`` the set-up here is really good and all the coaching , conditioning and medical staff have been really good in getting me back to full fitness . ''

documents.title: hundreds of yorkshire bus drivers on strike
text: hundreds of bus drivers are on a 24-hour strike over pay and shifts .
about 850 arriva drivers at depots in castleford , dewsbury , heckmondwike and wakefield in west yorkshire , and selby in north yorkshire , were due to strike .
the walkout started at 03:00 and bus passengers are being urged to plan for a longer journey .
arriva apologised and said it was disappointed that the unite union had not accepted its latest offer to try to resolve the dispute .
`` we are disappointed that the union negotiating committee refused to ballot members on this increased offer in favour of a 24-hour stoppage , '' arriva said .
unite officer phil bown said : `` strike action is not being taken by our members on the back of a whim . ''
